column4: Could someone please tell me what the program name is that handles "Sound Preferences" located on the Ubuntu toobar speaker icon. Thank you for your thoughtful answers.
Try running it and at the same time type ps aux from the terminal. You should see it ther, most likely it starts with gnome-*
Thank you very much I will try that :-)
YW. Make sure you don't have a lot of running apps or  the one you'r looking for might get lost. The name should be easy to spot enough.
I have seen the problem you mentioned on Oneiric 11.10 w/my track pad on my laptop.
Oh your trackpad is not working too?
how about keyboard? I'm still on Natty. I have never seen this issue before. Never in my whole "Ubuntu life". hehehe
What happens is my track pad will freeze .  No my keyboard runs fine . I only have a issue with my track pad.
I updated my kernel to the latest 3.2.0 kernel and it solved my trackpad problem . Perhaps it could solve yours.
Oh ok. good for you. having no track/touchpad is better than no keyboard at all :( I can't type anything.
Thanks. I doubt it. It was working fine. Stupid AMD Catalyst driver really screwed up my system. I 've done this before a lot of times but never this badly. I always was able to restore it.
I also updated my kernel on my Linuxmint 11 which is based on natty to kernel 3.2 too.
what PPA are you using for that kernel? I"ve not found one about a month ago. Unless you are compiling it from scratch?
Yes AMD drivers are still a bit klugy on Linux as a whole. Yet in windows AMD out performs Nvidia at the present time. But nVidia does very well on Linux.

here is the link use the PPA it's the easiest approach. You might have to modify the PPA to read oneiric instead of natty . That's what I had to do . But kernel 3.2 runs like a charm on my Linuxmint 11 partition just fine :-)
